page.title: 13Countryside-Amberley Rackham
page.content: The major part of this area is classed as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It includes a stretch of the South Downs Way, much used by local people walking dogs and long distance walkers. This area reaches from Amberley Mount to Rackham and to Kithurst Hill. The watermeadows, known as Amberley Wildbrooks are well known for their flora and fauna and attract many visitors. Building is restricted in this area, although some new houses are built mainly on the outskirts of villages, subject to regulations. This is because the area is a conservation area. Part of Amberley Village is also a conservation area.
